attributes.additional_details:
The market area is billed to be transformed into a “mix use cultural development”.
This seems to completely ignore the fact that the market has a long 900 year history and is itself a historic part of British culture.
Not only this, many traders, small businesses and individuals rely on this market as a source of income and stock. Many businesses will simply close because of this decision - hardly politics for economic growth!
attributes.background:
The City of London Corporation voted on 26/11/2024 to cease the trading of the Smithfield Meat Market.
We wish for this decision to be reconsidered and ultimately overturned.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about Smithfield meat market are a decision for the City of London Corporation.

You could ask your MP to take action on your concerns about this issue, including by asking them to present a public petition about this.

You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP

You can also raise this issue with the City of London Corporation. You can find contact details for the City of London Corporation here: https://www.cityoflondon.gov.uk/footer/contact-the-city-corporation
